001package imagingbook.lib.image.access;
002
003import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
004import imagingbook.lib.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
005
006/**
007 * A specific vector-valued image accessor for RGB images
008 * (direct subclass of {@link VectorAccessor}).
009 */
010public class RgbAccessor extends VectorAccessor {
011        
012        private final int[] pixels;
013
014        public RgbAccessor(ColorProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
015                super(ip, 3, obs, ipm);
016                this.pixels = (int[]) this.ip.getPixels();
017        }
018        
019        @Override
020        protected ScalarAccessor makeComponentAccessor(int k) {
021                return new ComponentAccessor((ColorProcessor)ip, outOfBoundsStrategy, interpolationMethod, k);
022        }
023        
024        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
025
026        @Override
027        public float[] getPix(int u, int v) { // returns an RGB value packed into a float[]
028                float red = componentAccessors[0].getVal(u, v);  //(c & 0xff0000) >> 16;
029                float grn = componentAccessors[1].getVal(u, v);  //(c & 0xff00) >> 8;
030                float blu = componentAccessors[2].getVal(u, v);  //(c & 0xff);
031                return new float[] { red, grn, blu };
032        }
033        
034        @Override
035        public float[] getPix(double x, double y) {
036                float red = componentAccessors[0].getVal(x, y);
037                float grn = componentAccessors[1].getVal(x, y);
038                float blu = componentAccessors[2].getVal(x, y); 
039                return new float[] { red, grn, blu };
040        }
041        
042        @Override
043        public void setPix(int u, int v, float[] valf) {
044                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
045                        componentAccessors[k].setVal(u, v, valf[k]);
046                }
047        }
048        
049        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
050        
051        private interface ComponentGetter {
052                /**
053                 * Function to extract a particular RGB component from an integer.
054                 * @param rgb a packed RGB integer
055                 * @return a component value
056                 */
057                int get(int rgb); 
058        }
059        
060        private interface ComponentSetter {
061                /**
062                 * Function to insert a particular component value into an integer.
063                 * @param rgb a packed RGB integer
064                 * @param c the component value to insert
065                 * @return the modified RGB integer
066                 */
067                int set(int rgb, int c);
068        }
069        
070        /**
071         * Defines a scalar image accessor for one particular color component.
072         * This is a non-static inner class, which shares data with the enclosing
073         * {@link RgbAccessor} instance.
074         * Note that this subclass of {@link ScalarAccessor} has no ImageProcessor
075         * of is own, but {@link #getProcessor()} returns the original 
076         * {@link ColorProcessor} instance.
077         */
078        private class ComponentAccessor extends ScalarAccessor {
079                
080                private final int k;    // the RGB component index = 0,1,2
081                        
082                private final ComponentGetter[] getComponent = {                        // note the fancy use of lambda expressions!
083                                (rgb) -> (rgb & 0xff0000) >> 16,        // extract red component
084                                (rgb) -> (rgb & 0x00ff00) >> 8,         // extract green component
085                                (rgb) -> (rgb & 0x0000ff) };            // extract blue component
086                
087                private final ComponentSetter[] setComponent = {
088                                (rgb, r) -> (rgb & 0xff00ffff) | (r & 0xff) << 16,      // insert red component
089                                (rgb, g) -> (rgb & 0xffff00ff) | (g & 0xff) << 8,       // insert green component
090                                (rgb, b) -> (rgb & 0xffffff00) | (b & 0xff)                     // insert blue component
091                };
092                
093                private ComponentAccessor(ColorProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm, int k) {
094                        super(ip, obs, ipm);
095                        this.k = k;
096                }
097
098                @Override
099                public float getVal(int u, int v) {
100                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
101                        if (i < 0) {
102                                return this.defaultValue;
103                        } else {
104                                return getComponent[k].get(pixels[i]);
105                        }
106                }
107
108                @Override
109                public void setVal(int u, int v, float val) {
110                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
111                        if (i >= 0) {
112                                int vali = clamp(Math.round(val));
113                                pixels[i] = setComponent[k].set(pixels[i], vali);
114                        }
115                }
116                
117                private int clamp(int val) {
118                        if (val < 0) return 0;
119                        if (val > 255) return 255;
120                        return val;
121                }
122        }
123
124}
